Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HdMac (H. discus macin, natural AMPs, UCSS1a, mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, marine invertebrates, animals; BBL)

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression: constitutively expressed in all five tested tissues: hmuscle (marginal), epatopancreas, gills and mantle (moderate), and hemocytes (high). It can also be induced after Vibrio harveyi stimulation.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (43.21%) toHydramacin-1G: 11%. GRAVY: -0.093; mol wt: 8968.49; mol formula: C388H613N111O111S11; mol ex coeff: 35227.5.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed and purified for this study: pET-30a vector; E. coli BL21 (DE3) LysS; Ni2+ affinity column.Activity: active against Gram+ S-aureus (MIC > 16 uM), V. anguillarum (MIC 0.5-1.0 uM), V. alginolyticus (MIC 1.0-2.0 uM), V. parahemolyticus (MIC 2.0-4.0 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 1.0-2.0 uM), E. coli (MIC 1.0-2.0 uM), and P. mirabidis (MIC 2-4 uM). Inhibited formation of biofilms:bacteria:E. coli.Animal model:abalone: silencing of HdMac via dsRNA injection increased animal mortaliity by 30% after V. harveyi challenge.
Literature Information.Author: Jiao C, Ruan J, Sun W, Zhang X, Liu X, Sun G, Liu C, Sun C, Tian X, Yang D, Chen L, Wang Z. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Molecular characterization, expression and antibacterial function of a macin, HdMac, from Haliotis discus hannai.
